CatDescriptText: Mr. Primus Gray, worker at Pittsburgh Coke and Chemical plant, 2239 Bloomer Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "I don't think that they should have to report the way they spend the money. I don't think that you should punish the majority of those receiving mother's assistance because of just one or two bad persons."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Primus Gray wearing plaid coat, standing on Liberty Avenue with Kappels in background, Downtown
